p: The progression of COVID-19 has been hypothesized to be across 3 overlapping yet distinct stages. This includes stage 1, for early infection with constitutional symptoms, and stage 2, in which there is viral entry and replication in the type II pneumocytes, causing direct viral cytotoxicity and activation of inflammatory immune response, leading to ARDS and hypoxia. If the immune response is unable to clear the virus in a productive and protective fashion, stage 3 ensues, which is a hyperinflammatory state, and there is multiorgan dysfunction due to a cytokine storm ( 10).
